data.title: Branch and Office Network Services at Citizens
data.meta_description: Ready to thrive, personally and professionally. Learn more about and apply for the Platform Manager - Branch and Office Network Services job at Citizens now.
data.text:
Description

Position: Platform Manager - Branch and Office Network Services

Department: Network Services

Location: Remote

Job Summary:

Citizens Bank is seeking an experienced Platform Manager to lead the development and operations of our Branch and Office Networking services. The Platform Manager will be responsible for ensuring that both colleagues and customers experience seamless connectivity within CFG branches or offices. This role requires an individual who can balance strategic vision with hands-on technical skills to oversee the architecture and operations of our wired and wireless networking services.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the strategic vision for delivering exceptional wired and wireless network connectivity experiences in CFG branches and offices.

Serve as the subject matter expert (SME) for Campus/LAN networking, constantly improving services based on user feedback and technological advancements.

Manage the entire product lifecycle, from strategic planning to operational support, ensuring high availability and performance of networking services.

Define and prioritize the product backlog, focusing on architectural enhancements, feature updates, and resolving technical issues.

Develop and communicate a detailed product roadmap, setting clear expectations for deliverables and timelines.

Collaborate with network engineering teams to design and implement robust network solutions using Cisco, Juniper, and Aruba technologies.

Oversee the integration of advanced routing and switching protocols including BGP, OSPF, and Spanning Tree Protocol.

Manage Power over Ethernet (PoE) deployments and optimize Wi-Fi services for maximum coverage and performance.

Liaise with vendors, internal IT teams, and business stakeholders to align network services with organizational needs and objectives.

Required Skills:

Deep knowledge of Cisco and Juniper network hardware and management software.

Expertise in designing and operating route/switch environments, with a strong grasp of BGP, OSPF, and Spanning Tree Protocol.

Experience with Power over Ethernet (PoE) implementations and managing Wi-Fi technologies, preferably Aruba.

Familiarity with the latest trends in LAN architecture and wireless networking.

Proven track record of managing complex technical projects and cross-functional teams.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Network Engineering, or a related field.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in network architecture or operations, with a focus on LAN and wireless technologies.

Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, JNCIA, or CWNA are highly preferred.

Strong analytical, leadership, and communication skills.

Pay Transparency

The salary range for this position is $ 184,080 - $ 276,120 per year plus an opportunity to earn an annual discretionary bonus. Actual pay is based on various factors including but not limited to the work location, and relevant skills and experience.

We offer competitive pay, comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage, retirement benefits, maternity/paternity leave, flexible work arrangements, education reimbursement, wellness programs and more. Note, Citizens’ paid time off policy exceeds the mandatory, paid sick or paid time-away policy of very local and state jurisdiction in the United States. For an overview of our benefits, visit https://jobs.citizensbank.com/benefits.

Some job boards have started using jobseeker-reported data to estimate salary ranges for roles. If you apply and qualify for this role, a recruiter will discuss accurate pay guidance.

Equal Employment Opportunity

At Citizens we value diversity, equity and inclusion, and treat everyone with respect and professionalism. Employment decisions are based solely on experience, performance, and ability. Citizens, its parent, subsidiaries, and related companies (Citizens) provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, citizenship, physical or mental disability, perceived disability or history or record of a disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression (including transgender individuals who are transitioning, have transitioned, or are perceived to be transitioning to the gender with which they identify), genetic information, genetic characteristic, marital or domestic partner status, victim of domestic violence, family status/parenthood, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, pregnancy/childbirth/lactation, colleague’s or a dependent’s reproductive health decision making, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.

Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer

Citizens is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective affiliates.
